body:
Comment 2 by **kballard**: 
And yet, without `-pedantic`, it works just fine. Clearly they realized that \e is a
useful sequence, even if it's not part of C99 (like a lot of other language extensions).

And you're right, not all languages support \e. But every one that I tried off the top
of my head (Ruby, Python, Perl, bash, and C without -pedantic) all support it. Is there
any particular reason not to support \e, besides the fact that C99 doesn't?

And yes, I do know I can write \x1b and \033. But I can also write \x0a or \012 for
newlines, and yet I choose to write \n because it's simpler and more obvious to the
reader.
